turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Blitz-class aviso.
turn.1: What was the main shipbuilding project of the Blitz-class?
turn.2: The ships marked a significant advance in naval technology for the German fleet; they were the first steel-hulled vessels, and they were the first cruiser-type vessels to abandon traditional sailing masts.
turn.3: What is the main weapon of the Blitz-class?
turn.4: Their armament—a torpedo tube and a battery of light guns—reflected the growing importance of the torpedo as a weapon, since the torpedo tube served as its primary offensive armament and the guns were necessary to defend against the increasingly powerful torpedo boats of the period.
turn.5: Is there anything else interesting about the Blitz-class?
turn.6: At the time of their completion, they were among the earliest torpedo cruisers in the world.
turn.7: What did the Blitz-class look like on the inside?
turn.8: The "Blitz" class avisos were the first step toward creating the modern, steel-hulled light cruiser, and their modern appearance presaged later developments.
turn.9: What did the Blitz-class lead to?
turn.10: Development of the aviso type would ultimately come to fruition in the light cruisers, built a decade later.
turn.11: Was the Blitz-class used in battle?
turn.12: The "Blitz" design proved to be an effective one, as evidenced by the fact that "Blitz" remained in active service for thirty-five years.
